title: Can the effect of Fabled Andwraith summon my opponent's Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring that was discarded to activate its effect?
question:
While I control a Fabled Andwraith, I activate Foolish Burial. In response, my opponent activates the effect of Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring by discarding it.

In this case, can I use the effect of Fabled Andwraith to Special Summon that Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring with its effects negated?
answer:
Yes, you can.

The Trigger Effect of Fabled Andwraith in question can be activated in a new Chain after resolving the current Chain where Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring negated the effect of Foolish Burial. (The effect is not activated immediately when the monster is sent to the Graveyard.)

In the given situation, the effect of Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring activated as Chain Link 2 negates the effect of Foolish Burial activated as Chain Link 1. Then, after the Chain has resolved, the effect of Fabled Andwraith can be activated as Chain Link 1 in a new Chain.
llm_answer: Yes, you can use Fabled Andwraith's effect to Special Summon Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring from your opponent's Graveyard with its effects negated. Fabled Andwraith's effect triggers when a card is discarded to the Graveyard, which includes when an opponent discards a card to activate an effect.
